alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Jackson; Lincoln (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:50PM CDT until March 31 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR JACKSON...EASTERN BIENVILLE AND SOUTHERN LINCOLN PARISHES... At 1049 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles northwest of Jonesboro, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Ruston, Grambling, Jonesboro, Arcadia, Choudrant, Simsboro, Chatham, Hodge, North Hodge, Vienna, East Hodge, Lucky, Bienville, Quitman, Eros, Bryceland, Brice, Friendship, Liberty Hill and Mount Olive. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room.
